dataIdInfo.idAbs: The Create Riverscapes Project tool populates a user-specified folder workspace with two directories: ProjectInputs and Realizations. These directories will subsequently be used by the General Solar Insolation Surface and Solar Insolation for a Stream Network tools. This tool also creates the Riverscapes project XML file ("project.rs.xml"), and populates the file with basic information.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: South Fork Research, Inc. Jesse Langdon

tool.name: CreateProjectTool

param.name: rs_dir
param.dialogReference: Workspace which will store data inputs and outputs, and the project XML file (i.e. project.rs.xml). If the workspace is not empty, the tool will halt with an error. This must be an empty workspace.

param.name: region_name
param.dialogReference: Indicates the Riverscape region in which the project extent is located. Currently this parameter only provides one option, "CRB" (Columbia River Basin). Addtional options may be added in future versions.

param.name: wshd_name
param.expression: Big-Navarro-Garcia (CA) | Clearwater | Entiat | Hells Canyon | Imnaha | Little Salmon | Lower John Day | Lower Selway | Lemhi | Lolo Creek | Lower Salmon | Lower Snake-Asotin | Lower Snake-Tucannon | Methow | Middle Fork John Day | Middle Salmon-Panther | Minam | North Fork John Day | Okanogan | Pahsimeroi | South Fork Salmon | Umatilla | Upper Grande Ronde | Upper John Day | Upper Middle Fork Salmon | Walla Walla | Wenatchee | Yankee Fork
param.dialogReference: Name of the ISEMP/CHaMP watershed in which represents the geographic extent of the Riverscapes project.

param.name: proj_name
param.dialogReference: Name of the Riverscapes project. This will be stored in the project XML file.

tool.summary: The Create Riverscapes Project tool populates a user-specified folder workspace with two directories: ProjectInputs and Realizations. These directories will subsequently be used by the General Solar Insolation Surface and Solar Insolation for a Stream Network tools. This tool also creates the Riverscapes project XML file ("project.rs.xml"), and populates the file with basic information.
